title: How to Earn a Bug Badge in Animal Crossing: New Leaf

steps.headline: Look at the Bug Catcher Badge.
steps.description:
You'll need to catch a certain amount of bugs. Just to note that the type of bug does not matter. Bronze rank: Catch 500 bugs
Silver rank: Catch 2,000 bugs
Gold rank: Catch 5,000 bugs

steps.headline: Look at the Insect Maniac Badge.
steps.description:
This depends on your personal bug encyclopedia. Bronze rank: Complete 50% of the encyclopedia
Silver rank: Complete 80% of the encyclopedia
Gold rank: Complete 100% of the encyclopedia

steps.headline: Locate Phineas.
steps.description: When a player achieves the minimum for a level, Phineas will appear somewhere in town on clear days.

steps.headline: Talk to him.
steps.description: At times, he'll give you multiple badges, so just keep pressing buttons.

steps.headline: View your badge on your Town Pass Card.
steps.description: Learn that ranks override each other, so if you achieve a bronze, a silver one will override it instead of showing both ranks.

text:
Look at the Bug Catcher Badge. You'll need to catch a certain amount of bugs. Just to note that the type of bug does not matter. Bronze rank: Catch 500 bugs
Silver rank: Catch 2,000 bugs
Gold rank: Catch 5,000 bugs Look at the Insect Maniac Badge. This depends on your personal bug encyclopedia. Bronze rank: Complete 50% of the encyclopedia
Silver rank: Complete 80% of the encyclopedia
Gold rank: Complete 100% of the encyclopedia Accomplish the minimum amount required.  Locate Phineas. When a player achieves the minimum for a level, Phineas will appear somewhere in town on clear days. Talk to him. At times, he'll give you multiple badges, so just keep pressing buttons. View your badge on your Town Pass Card. Learn that ranks override each other, so if you achieve a bronze, a silver one will override it instead of showing both ranks.
